intro: Oxyanthus lepidus var. unyorensis, commonly known as the Java oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
